Package payrollObjects

Class Date

java.lang.Object
payrollObjects.Date
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Date>
public class Date
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Date>
This class defines the properties and operations of a Date object. A date consists of a month, day, and year.
Author:
Matthew Brandao, Armit Patel

  • Constructor Details

    • Date

      public Date​(java.lang.String date)
      Creates an instance of Date and initializes attribute values to the value of the string passed. Splits string contents from expected "/" delimiter into month, day, and year.
      Parameters:
      date - a date represented as a string

    • Date

      public Date()
      Creates an instance of Date and initializes attributes representing today's date.

  • Method Details

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo​(Date date)
      Compares an instance of Date to a relative instance of Date that is provided as parameter. Determines whether this date is earlier, the same, or greater than the relative date.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Date>
      Parameters:
      date - the date this instance of Date will be compare to.
      Returns:
      -1 if this date is earlier than the relative date, 0 if this date is the same as the relative date, 1 if this date is newer than the relative date

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the Date in the format month/day/year.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      the string representation of Date

    • getDay

      public int getDay()
      Returns an integer value of the day of this instance of Date.
      Returns:
      the day of the date

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Checks if a date is valid. A date is valid if the year, month, and day are in correct formatting. A correct year contains the values 1900 to the value of the current year. A correct month contains the values 1 to 12. A correct day's upper bound value depends on whether the month is a long month(31), medium month(30), short month(28), or a leap year(29). The lower bound for day's value in all scenarios is 1.
      Returns:
      true if the date is valid, false if the date is not valid

    • isLeapYear

      private boolean isLeapYear()
      Determines if the integer value of this instance of Date's year attribute is a leap year or not.
      Returns:
      leapYear true if the year attribute is a leap year, false if the year attribute is not a leap year

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      The testbed main to thoroughly test the isValid() method with created test cases.
      Parameters:
      args - args for system to run
